intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive trifoliate structure, and its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
